title: TypeScript for Beginners
description: Master TypeScript fundamentals and apply them in real-world JavaScript projects.
overview: This beginner-friendly course introduces TypeScript syntax, types, and its integration with JavaScript. Ideal for developers transitioning from JS.

syllabus.title: Introduction
syllabus.description: Why TypeScript? Setting up your environment.

syllabus.title: Module 1: Basic Types
syllabus.description: Learn about string, number, boolean, array, and tuples.

syllabus.title: Module 2: Functions and Interfaces
syllabus.description: Create reusable and typed functions with interfaces.

syllabus.title: Module 3: Classes & Objects
syllabus.description: Apply object-oriented principles in TypeScript.

syllabus.title: Module 4: Type Inference and Advanced Types
syllabus.description: Understand type inference, unions, intersections, and type aliases.

instructor.name: Sarah Lin
instructor.description: Sarah is a full-stack developer specializing in modern JavaScript and TypeScript with over 8 years of experience.

title: Advanced TypeScript Patterns
description: Deep dive into generics, decorators, and advanced typing strategies.
overview: This course is for developers familiar with TypeScript looking to explore advanced features and patterns in enterprise-grade apps.

syllabus.title: Introduction
syllabus.description: Scope of advanced TypeScript and review of foundational concepts.

syllabus.title: Module 1: Generics in Practice
syllabus.description: Implement generic functions and classes effectively.

syllabus.title: Module 2: Utility Types
syllabus.description: Use built-in utility types to reduce boilerplate code.

syllabus.title: Module 3: Custom Decorators
syllabus.description: Create and apply decorators in TypeScript projects.

syllabus.title: Module 4: Design Patterns
syllabus.description: Leverage patterns like Factory, Singleton, and Observer.

instructor.name: Daniel Kross
instructor.description: Daniel designs scalable front-end systems with a strong emphasis on maintainability and type safety.

title: TypeScript with React
description: Build scalable React applications using TypeScript for strong typing and developer safety.
overview: A practical course combining TypeScript with modern React, covering props, state, hooks, and component patterns.

syllabus.title: Introduction
syllabus.description: Why TypeScript with React? Project setup and tools.

syllabus.title: Module 1: Typing Props and State
syllabus.description: Use interfaces and types with components.

syllabus.title: Module 2: Hooks with TypeScript
syllabus.description: Implement typed useState, useEffect, and custom hooks.

syllabus.title: Module 3: Context & Reducers
syllabus.description: Manage global state with Context API and useReducer.

syllabus.title: Module 4: Patterns & Testing
syllabus.description: Best practices for scalable React+TS codebases.

instructor.name: Maya Chen
instructor.description: Maya teaches modern React development with a focus on TypeScript and clean code practices.

title: Node.js with TypeScript
description: Create robust backend APIs using Node.js and TypeScript.
overview: This course walks you through building Express.js APIs with TypeScript, including validation, middlewares, and testing.

syllabus.title: Introduction
syllabus.description: Setting up Node.js with TypeScript.

syllabus.title: Module 1: Express with TS
syllabus.description: Typing routes, requests, and responses.

syllabus.title: Module 2: Middlewares
syllabus.description: Implement and type middleware functions.

syllabus.title: Module 3: Validation & Errors
syllabus.description: Use Zod or Yup for input validation.

syllabus.title: Module 4: Testing APIs
syllabus.description: Unit and integration testing using Jest.

instructor.name: Luis Ortega
instructor.description: Luis builds fast and scalable APIs and is passionate about developer tooling and testing.

title: TypeScript in Monorepos
description: Manage TypeScript projects at scale using Nx, Turborepo, and modern tooling.
overview: Understand how to structure large-scale applications with TypeScript in a monorepo setup.

syllabus.title: Introduction
syllabus.description: What are monorepos? Advantages & challenges.

syllabus.title: Module 1: Setting Up with Nx
syllabus.description: Create a workspace and structure applications.

syllabus.title: Module 2: Type Sharing
syllabus.description: Use libraries to share types across projects.

syllabus.title: Module 3: Build & Lint Pipelines
syllabus.description: Maintain consistency and enforce standards.

syllabus.title: Module 4: CI/CD Integration
syllabus.description: Deploy and test using GitHub Actions.

instructor.name: Amara Smith
instructor.description: Amara focuses on TypeScript infrastructure and developer experience in large organizations.
